intro: Aizoon contaminatum, commonly known as the common tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow, daisy-like flowers and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows, stream banks, and marshy areas. It is an annual or biennial herb that can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Aizoon contaminatum is known for its aromatic properties and has been used historically in traditional medicine.
